required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-label Extension Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Upadacitinib (ABT-494) in Rheumatoid Arthritis Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Study, Multicenter, Open-Label Extension (OLE) Study in Rheumatoid Arthritis Subjects Who Have Completed a Preceding Phase 2 Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT) With Upadacitinib (ABT-494)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 2, multicenter, open-label extension study in RA subjects. The sub-study is to assess the impact of upadacitinib treatment (15 mg QD and 30 mg QD) with background MTX on immunological responses to Prevnar 13Â® in RA patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Work Instability Scale - Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA-WIS)

primary_outcome.description: ACR criteria measures improvement in tender or swollen joint counts.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index
primary_outcome.description: Determined by the Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ-DI)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient's Global Assessment of Disease Activity
Change in Patient's Assessment of Pain
primary_outcome.description: Determined by the Joint Evaluation, Visual Analog Scale (VAS), EuroQoL-5D (EQ-5D)
Swollen Joint Count will be assessed by a qualified Independent Joint Assessor or Principal Investigator using the Joint Evaluation Worksheet.
The sum of tender and swollen joint counts [28 joints] and patient and physician global assessments
ACR criteria measures improvement in tender or swollen joint counts.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving Low Disease Activity
primary_outcome.description: Determined by disease activity score using 28 joint counts (DAS28) [CRP] or clinical disease activity index (CDAI) criteria

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy - Fatigue (FACIT-F) Scale

primary_outcome.description: ACR criteria measures improvement in tender or swollen joint counts.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving Clinical Remission
primary_outcome.description: Determined by DAS28 [CRP] and CDAI criteria
Tender Joint Count will be assessed by a qualified Independent Joint Assessor or Principal Investigator using the Joint Evaluation Worksheet.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 through 30 day follow-up visit (30 days after last dose of study drug)
primary_outcome.description: Clinical Laboratory Data include hematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with satisfactory humoral response to Prevnar 13
primary_outcome.description: Satisfactory response is defined as greater than or equal to 2-fold increase in antibody concentration from the vaccination baseline in at least 6 out of the 12 pneumococcal antigens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with satisfactory humoral response to Prevnar 13
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfactory response is defined as greater than or equal to 2-fold increase in antibody concentration from the vaccination baseline in at least 6 out of the 12 pneumococcal antigens

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in geometric mean fold rise of anti-pneumococcal antibody levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 12 of the sub-study (approximately 252 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-pneumococcal antibody levels to each of the 12 pneumococcal antigens above vaccination baseline values.

arm_group.description: All subjects will start treatment with ABT-494.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who have completed Study M13-550 or Study M13-537 with Upadacitinib (ABT-494) and has not developed any discontinuation criteria.
2. If the subject has evidence of new latent Tuberculosis (TB) infection, the subject must initiate and complete a minimum of 2 weeks (or per local guidelines, whichever is longer) of an ongoing TB prophylaxis before continuing to receive study drug.
3. If female, subject must meet one of the following criteria:
- Postmenopausal (defined as no menses for at least 1 year).
- Surgically sterile (bilateral oophorectomy or hysterectomy).
- Practicing from the time of screening until at least 30 days after the last dose of study drug at least TWO of the following methods of birth control:
1. Tubal ligation
2. Partner vasectomy (at least 6 months earlier) (the vasectomized male partner should be the sole partner for that female subject)
3. Intrauterine device
4. A male condom with spermicidal jelly or cream
5. Diaphragm, contraceptive sponge or cervical cap with spermicidal jelly or cream
6. Hormonal contraceptives (injected, oral, transdermal or implanted methods) must have been taking at least 2 months prior to dosing
4. Male subjects must agree to follow protocol-specified pregnancy avoidance measures, including refraining from donating sperm, for up to 30 days post last dose of study drug.
5. Subjects must voluntarily sign and date an informed consent, approved by an Independent Ethics Committee (IEC)/Institutional Review Board (IRB), prior to the initiation of any screening or study specific procedures.
Substudy:
1. Must currently be enrolled in the main study.
2. Must have been receiving a stable dose of upadacitinib (either 15 mg QD or 30 mg QD) for a minimum of 4 weeks prior to the Vaccination visit.
3. Must have been on a stable dose of background methotrexate (no change in dose or frequency) for a minimum of 4 weeks prior to the Vaccination visit.
4. If subject is on corticosteroids, must remain on a stable dose of â¤ 10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent corticosteroid therapy for at least 4 weeks after the vaccination visit.
5. Must meet the prescribing specifications as per local label requirements to receive Prevnar 13Â® vaccine.
6. Willing to receive Prevnar13Â® vaccine.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant or breastfeeding female.
2. Ongoing infections at Week 0 that have NOT been successfully treated. Subjects with ongoing infections undergoing treatment may be enrolled BUT NOT dosed until the infection has been successfully treated.
3. Anticipated requirement or receipt of any live vaccine during study participation including up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug.
4. Laboratory values from the visit immediately prior to Baseline Visit (local requirements may apply) meeting the following criteria:
- Serum aspartate transaminase (AST) or alanine transaminase (ALT) > 3.0 Ã Upper Limit of Normal (ULN)
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate by simplified 4-variable Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) formula < 40mL/min/1.73m2
- Total white blood cell count (WBC) < 2,000/Î¼L
- Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) < 1,000/Î¼L
- Platelet count < 50,000/Î¼L
- Absolute lymphocytes count < 500/Î¼L
- Hemoglobin < 8 gm/dL
5. Enrollment in another interventional clinical study while participating in this study.
6. Consideration by the investigator, for any reason, that the subject is an unsuitable candidate to receive study drug.
Substudy:
1. Receiving any csDMARDs other than MTX
2. Receiving > 10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent corticosteroid therapy.
3. Receipt of any steroid injection within 4 weeks prior to Vaccination visit.
4. History of severe allergic reaction (e.g., anaphylaxis) to any component of Prevnar 13Â®.
5. History of any documented pneumococcal infection within the last 6 months prior to the vaccination visit.
6. Receipt of any vaccine 4 weeks prior to the vaccination visit and/or anticipation of any vaccination for 4 weeks after the vaccination visit.
7. Receipt of any pneumococcal vaccine.
8. Subject is not suitable for the sub-study as per the Investigator's judgment.

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
